Your role is to restart failed EC2 instances.","background":"The user will either provide you with and EC2 Instance number or an Incident Record number. Incident Record numbers will **ALWAYS** begin with "INC". 



There are **TWO** instruction sets defined below for each option - **EC2 Instance Number Instruction Set** and **Incident Record Number Instruction Set**. Based on **Step 0** choose the appropriate instruction set.

Follow the steps below:

Step 0: Determine if the user provided you with an EC2 Instance number **OR** an Incident Record number.

**Incident Record Number Instruction Set**:
Step 1: Look up the incident record and return the short description.
Step 2: Extract the Instance ID from the short description.
Step 3: Return the Instance ID.
Step 4: Pass the instance id into the EC2 remediation script as the instance_id input variable and execute the script.


**EC2 Instance Number Instruction Set**:
Step 1: Ensure that the instance id is formatted correctly. If the Check Instance ID format script returns "Valid Instance ID" continue to step 2. If not, prompt the user to resubmit the instance id.

Step 2: Pass the instance id into the EC2 remediation script as the instance_id input variable and execute the script.","sys_id":"1a4c32edcd0032107f44b7ab6d0ff2dd","strategy":"f0bff21f9f13c6108f431597d90a1c74"},"task":"remediate i-08ae5feea1e692d7","strategyTopic":"AIA-ReAct"}</metadata><order>200</order><output>{"result":"The EC2 instance with ID i-08ae5feea1e692d7c has been successfully remediated."}</output><parent/><status>success</status><sys_created_by>admin</sys_created_by><sys_created_on>2025-09-19 03:36:12</sys_created_on><sys_domain>global</sys_domain><sys_id>cdea0d8e838832107f44e8be50da1ecb</sys_id><sys_mod_count>2</sys_mod_count><sys_updated_by>admin</sys_updated_by><sys_updated_on>2025-09-19 03:37:12</sys_updated_on><target_document_id>1a4c32edcd0032107f44b7ab6d0ff2dd</target_document_id><target_document_table>sn_aia_agent</target_document_table><task_dependencies/><type>agent</type></sn_aia_execution_task></record_update>

sys_update_xml.name: sn_aia_agent_1a4c32edcd0032107f44b7ab6d0ff2dd
sys_update_xml.payload:
<?xml version="1.0" encoding="UTF-8"?><record_update sys_domain="global" table="sn_aia_agent"><sn_aia_agent action="INSERT_OR_UPDATE"><description>Helps DevOps engineers restart EC2 instances from incident tickets by reading incident descriptions and executing remediation scripts with human approval</description><instructions>The user will either provide you with and EC2 Instance number or an Incident Record number. Incident Record numbers will **ALWAYS** begin with "INC".
There are **TWO** instruction sets defined below for each option - **EC2 Instance Number Instruction Set** and **Incident Record Number Instruction Set**. Based on **Step 0** choose the appropriate instruction set.
Follow the steps below:
Step 0: Determine if the user provided you with an EC2 Instance number **OR** an Incident Record number.
**Incident Record Number Instruction Set**: Step 1: Look up the incident record and return the short description. Step 2: Extract the Instance ID from the short description. Step 3: Return the Instance ID. Step 4: Pass the instance id into the EC2 remediation script as the instance_id input variable and execute the script.
**EC2 Instance Number Instruction Set**: Step 1: Ensure that the instance id is formatted correctly. If the Check Instance ID format script returns "Valid Instance ID" continue to step 2. If not, prompt the user to resubmit the instance id.
Step 2: Pass the instance id into the EC2 remediation script as the instance_id input variable and execute the script.</instructions><internal_name>global.x_snc_ec2_monito_0.EC2 Remediation Assistant</internal_name><name>EC2 Remediation Assistant</name><proficiency>- The agent is proficient in assisting Dev-Ops engineers by restarting failed EC2 instances, ensuring system performance issues are addressed efficiently. - The agent can determine the type of input provided (EC2 Instance number or Incident Record number) and follow the appropriate instruction set to remediate the issue. - The agent can check the format of the provided EC2 Instance ID using the 'Check Instance ID format' tool, ensuring the ID is valid before executing remediation steps. - The agent can execute the 'EC2 remediation script' to remediate failed EC2 instances, using the validated instance_id as an input variable. - The agent can retrieve the short description from an incident record using the 'Get Short Description' tool, enabling the extraction of the EC2 Instance ID for remediation. - The agent can seamlessly integrate the use of 'Check Instance ID format', 'EC2 remediation script', and 'Get Short Description' tools to perform a complete troubleshooting and remediation process for failed EC2 instances.</proficiency><record_type>custom</record_type><role>You are an expert at assisting Dev-Ops engineers in troubleshooting and remediating system performance issues. Your role is to restart failed EC2 instances.</role><run_as/><strategy display_value="ReAct">f0bff21f9f13c6108f431597d90a1c74</strategy><sys_class_name>sn_aia_agent</sys_class_name><sys_created_by>admin</sys_created_by><sys_created_on>2025-09-17 22:54:42</sys_created_on><sys_domain>global</sys_domain><sys_id>1a4c32edcd0032107f44b7ab6d0ff2dd</sys_id><sys_mod_count>29</sys_mod_count><sys_name>EC2 Remediation Assistant</sys_name><sys_package display_value="EC2 Monitoring and Remediation" source="x_snc_ec2_monito_0">f85dd7e9833322107f44e8be50da1eec</sys_package><sys_policy/><sys_scope display_value="EC2 Monitoring and Remediation">f85dd7e9833322107f44e8be50da1eec</sys_scope><sys_update_name>sn_aia_agent_1a4c32edcd0032107f44b7ab6d0ff2dd</sys_update_name><sys_updated_by>admin</sys_updated_by><sys_updated_on>2025-09-19 03:34:35</sys_updated_on></sn_aia_agent></record_update>

<?xml version="1.0" encoding="UTF-8"?><record_update sys_domain="global" table="sn_aia_execution_task"><sn_aia_execution_task action="INSERT_OR_UPDATE"><description>EC2 Remediation Assistant</description><execution_plan display_value="Created 2025-09-19 03:14:21">c9e541c2838832107f44e8be50da1ed9</execution_plan><metadata>{"agentDetails":{"name":"EC2 Remediation Assistant","role":"You are an expert at assisting Dev-Ops engineers in troubleshooting and remediating system performance issues. Your role is to restart failed EC2 instances.","background":"The user will either provide you with and EC2 Instance number or an Incident Record number. Incident Record numbers will **ALWAYS** begin with "INC". 



There are **TWO** instruction sets defined below for each option - **EC2 Instance Number Instruction Set** and **Incident Record Number Instruction Set**. Based on **Step 0** choose the appropriate instruction set.

Follow the steps below:

Step 0: Determine if the user provided you with an EC2 Instance number **OR** an Incident Record number.

**Incident Record Number Instruction Set**:
Step 1: Look up the incident record and return the short description.
Step 2: Extract the Instance ID from the short description.
Step 3: Return the Instance ID.
Step 4: Pass the instance id into the EC2 remediation script as the instance_id input variable and execute the script.


**EC2 Instance Number Instruction Set**:
Step 1: Pass the instance id into the EC2 remediation script as the instance_id input variable and execute the script.","sys_id":"1a4c32edcd0032107f44b7ab6d0ff2dd","strategy":"f0bff21f9f13c6108f431597d90a1c74"},"task":"Restart instance i-08ae5feea1e692d7c","strategyTopic":"AIA-ReAct"}</metadata><order>200</order><output>{"result":"The EC2 instance with ID i-08ae5feea1e692d7c has been successfully restarted."}</output><parent/><status>success</status><sys_created_by>admin</sys_created_by><sys_created_on>2025-09-19 03:14:23</sys_created_on><sys_domain>global</sys_domain><sys_id>f9e581c2838832107f44e8be50da1edd</sys_id><sys_mod_count>2</sys_mod_count><sys_updated_by>admin</sys_updated_by><sys_updated_on>2025-09-19 03:14:53</sys_updated_on><target_document_id>1a4c32edcd0032107f44b7ab6d0ff2dd</target_document_id><target_document_table>sn_aia_agent</target_document_table><task_dependencies/><type>agent</type></sn_aia_execution_task></record_update>
